children.subject:
It is likely that it will be offered each spring.  It's possible that the lectures will be online,

although most of the lecture time will be students reporting on their progress and problems.

Will this course be offered another semester?

I'm really interested in the topic. I will be prototyping IoT devices for work over the Summer. However, I don't have the pre-requisites to take this course. I will be taking 151 this semester.


Is it possible for me to listen in on the lectures?

history.content:
EE 194/290C: 28nm SoC for IoT, Spring 2021, 4 units
CCN:  19788 (EE194) / 31029 (EE290C)
Instructors: Nikolic, Niknejad, Pister

Course Description:
In this class, we will design and send out for fabrication a
system-on-a-chip (SoC) intended for internet-of-things applications
(IoT).  The chip will contain a RISC-V microprocessor, a radio
transceiver, and a baseband signal processor, and will be designed in
a 28nm CMOS process (And we really mean it!)

The course will be hands-on, covering many of the aspects of practical
integrated circuit design, using state-of-the art tools in a modern
technology.   The students should expect to start practical design
through guided laboratory exercises from the very beginning, and all
students interested in this exciting opportunity will need to sign up
by the end of the first week of classes.

Pre-requisites: EE140/240A (Analog IC design) OR EECS151/251A (Digital ICs)
history.subject: Tapeout! CMOS System on Chip design EE194
